title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2021 - Bordeaux
description: « A day to celebrate passion and software crafting »  Une journée pour pratiquer et se former. Préparez-vous à apprendre plus de choses en une journée que ce que vous aurez appris tout au long de l'année.  Cet évènement international, basé sur le format de la coderetreat (coderetreat.org), vous propose de pratiquer le développement autour d'un problème simple (Conway's game of life) en pair programming, par session d'une heure.  Pour corser le tout, des contraintes sont ajoutées tout au long de la journée, afin d'obliger les participants à découvrir de nouvelles façons de résoudre le problème.  Ainsi, chaque session vous permet de découvrir de nouvelles façons de faire, vous améliorer en code. Et pourquoi pas, l'occasion d'essayer un nouveau langage?  Ça dure toute la journée, on commence le matin à 8h45, à midi on mange ensemble et le soir on prend un verre avec ceux qui le souhaitent.  Pour avoir plus d'information sur le format, vous pouvez consulter la page dédiée sur le site : https://www.coderetreat.org/pages/about/.

title: GDCR20 in Auckland
#GDCR goes remote
description: As developers we have long known that working remotely is efficient and can be done anywhere. Of course, getting to know each other personally is nice, but the health of everyone is our priority. Thus, this year’s event will take place at home - learning effects included. Isn't this precisely what the #GDCR is all about? Therefore, we are happy to accommodate the Global Day of Align code retreat as a "digital host". There are exciting workshops, programming tasks and challenges waiting to get solved cooperatively. The #GDCR is aimed at experienced and inexperienced software developers, as well at students with the goals: to experience modern software development, to deepen and question known techniques   and to exchange ideas with other developers.

title: GDCR Cape Town [remote]
Global Day Coderetreat 2021, Codurance Spain
description: Coderetreat has an established, time-tested format that is optimised for focused practice. We will be working on implementing Conway's Game Of Life in 45-minute sessions. In each one, you'll pair program in whichever language you like, using whichever technologies you and your pair prefer.  The day will start at 8:30am and finish by 16:30 pm. Lunch will be provided on the day. It's an early start, so sleep well the night before to help get those brain juices flowing.  Remember to bring your laptop and be ready to have fun! :)

title: Global (half) Day Retreat
description: Rejoignez-nous pour découvrir, apprendre et progresser tous ensemble ! A l’occasion du Global Day of Code Retreat, nous vous proposons une première édition de Code Retreat à Lausanne. Cet évènement aura lieu en présentiel, dans les locaux de socraft. SVP: Les places sont limitées, aussi soyez sûr de pouvoir venir si vous vous inscrivez. Le quotidien ne nous permet pas toujours d’expérimenter de nouvelles façons de faire. Cet évènement sera l’occasion de pratiquer, sans se presser : Un exercice de code sera proposé, et 3 sessions en binôme auront lieu pour le parcourir de manières différentes.

Global Day of Coderetreat @ Epam Systems Bangalore
description: Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Corrientes, Argentina
description:
El 14 de Diciembre se celebra el día mundial de los coderetreat desde ComunidadTIC, BarCampNEA, PoloIT Chaco, PoloIT Corrientes, GDG Corrientes y NEAValley te queremos invitar a unirte a la iniciativa. 
¿Necesito saber qué es TDD? 
No es necesario, puedes venir a aprender. Con que disfrutes con el código es suficiente! 
¿Qué debo llevar? 
Un portátil con los entornos instalados y configurados y sus librerías xUnit (phpUnit, nUnit, jUnit, jasmine, rspec, qUnit...) del lenguaje que planees usar. Zapatilla, alargador. 
¡Registrate! 
Es totalmente gratuito, sólo necesitas un portátil (con el software que necesitas para tu lenguaje, o lo descargas ese mismo día) y ganas de pasarlo bien. 
Para saber cuanto espacio vamos a necesitar ¡necesitamos que te inscribas! 
https://eventioz.com.ar/coderetreat-corrientes

description: Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Sydney, Australia
description:
Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time. 
Participate in the global coderetreat here in Sydney, NSW, Australia. 
Bring a laptop with all the development tools you require to write code using your chosen programming languages. 
Lunch will be provided. This event is free for everyone. 
Once registered, refer to Corey Haines's coderetreat site (http://coderetreat.com/) for further details on what to expect or turn up and have a great day.

I'll only be there for part of the day, as I've got another event that day. :(
No problems at all Andrew. Happy to have you for as long as we can get you :)
What time does it start / finish? How much does it cost?
Hi Joshua, the event is all day (9-5) and it's free for everyone.
How do we access the office? Will there be someone downstairs to let us in? 
Yep, there'll be a bunch of ThoughtWorks people around and we'll let everyone in/man the doors.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Vienna, Austria
description:
Since we started with the first Global Day of Coderetreat in 2011 Vienna already has a vivid crowd of software craftsmen, which is key for great companies and products, fit for the future. Software craftsmanship is the missing link many of us often even miss in so called Agile projects.
 
 This year we have Peter Kofler as facilitator on board. Peter probably is the most experienced facilitator for Coding Dojos and Coderetreats around Vienna at the moment. He just did his journeyman tour and many different facilitations as well as public talks. So your chances to learn great stuff at our event are tremendous. And of course it will be great fun too!
 
 Want to join as participant? Get your ticket here (it's free, we just ask for a deposit, which will be returned immediately to those showing up) -http://gdcr13-vienna.eventbrite.de (http://gdcr13-vienna.eventbrite.de/)
 Know others, your friends, peers at work, who might be interested too? Please, help spreading the word and tell them about our event.
 
 Want to see your company as sponsor? Please get in contact with us a toffice@agileexperts.at (mailto:office@agileexperts.at?subject=GDCR13%20Vienna%20-%20Request%20for%20Sponsorship)
 
 Looking forward to seeing you at the GDCR13 Vienna!
 best, Mike Leber
 
 PS: we are currently in touch with 2-3 options for the location in Vienna and let you know soon about it.

Was a great code retreat! Thanks for organizing this. Thanks all the sponsors for making this possible. Thanks Peter for facilitating. 
It is great to meet like-minded developers also interested in improving professionally and making the most of themselves. 
It is also a very productive place to practice coding, test-driven-development, learn, reflect, have new insights and have fun! 
Looking forward to the next one, to coding dojos, katas and pair-programming.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Essen, Germany
description:
OPITZ CONSULTING Deutschland GmbH (http://www.opitz-consulting.com/) is hosting the Global Day of Code Retreat 2013 in Essen this year. 
 // German // 
Ein "Coderetreat (http://archive.coderetreat.org/)" ist eine ganztägige Veranstaltung zum Üben und Verbessern der Fähigkeiten zur Software-Entwicklung und des Software-Designs. In entspannter Atmosphäre und ohne den Druck "fertig" werden zu müssen, können sich Entwickler vollständig auf das Programmieren selbst konzentrieren, Erkenntnisse gewinnen und Erfahrungen mit anderen Teilnehmern austauschen.
 
 Am Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) finden in vielen Städten auf der ganzen Welt Coderetreats statt - so auch dieses Jahr in Essen. Der Veranstaltungsort ist der Standort der OPITZ CONSULTING Deutschland GmbH (http://opitz-consulting.com/).
 
 Voraussetzung für die Teilnahme ist ein funktionsfähiges Notebook, auf dem alle Entwicklungstools eingerichtet sind, die Sie für das Entwickeln in Ihrer Lieblingsprogrammiersprache benötigen. 
Anmeldung: https://www.xing.com/events/global-day-of-coderetreat-2013-essen-germany-1321744

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Münster, Germany
description:
Am 14. Dezember findet weltweit der Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) statt und wir machen mit. 
Ein Coderetreat ist ein Workshop für Softwareentwickler, bei dem im Rahmen von 6 Sessions à 45 Minuten eine Programmieraufgabe mit unterschiedlichen Herausforderungen bearbeitet wird. Die Programmiersprache ist dabei frei wählbar; entwickelt wird grundsätzlich zu zweit (Pair Programming) und testgetrieben (TDD). Weitere Informationen… (http://archive.coderetreat.org/about) 
Warum sollte ich dahin gehen? 
 
 um moderne Softwareentwicklung zu erleben 
 um bekannte Techniken zu vertiefen und zu hinterfragen 
 um sich mit anderen Entwicklern auszutauschen 
 
Bitte bring einen Laptop mit funktionierender und getesteter Entwicklungsumgebungen für deine Programmiersprache(n) inklusive Framework für Unit-Tests mit. Wir wollen keine Zeit für Einrichtung verlieren. Wenn du im Paar kommst, dann reicht auch ein Laptop. 
Gleichzeitig organisiert der SoCraMOB (http://www.softwerkskammer.org/groups/socramob) auch in Bielefeld (http://www.softwerkskammer.org/activities/bi-gdcr-13) einen Coderetreat im Rahmen des Global Day of Coderetreat.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Osnabrück, Germany
description:
GDRP 2013 @ Osnabrück - Hosted and sponsored by University of Applied Science (http://www.ecs.hs-osnabrueck.de/) and LMIS AG (http://www.lmis.de/). // Durchgeführt und gesponsert von der Hochschule Osnabrück (http://www.ecs.hs-osnabrueck.de/) und der LMIS AG (http://www.lmis.de/). 
 
This year Osnabrück will also take part at the GDCR! It’ll be a funny day of learning new principles of software development and coding. Students are very welcome as well as employed software developers to share experiences and improve coding skills. Participation is for free – a lunch is included. Members only need to bring a laptop with installed programming environment for the favorite language. 
Register at: http://gdcr2013osnabrueck.eventbrite.de (http://gdcr2013osnabrueck.eventbrite.de/) 
// 
Im Jahr 2013 kommt der GDCR erstmals auch nach Osnabrück! Es wartet ein spannender und unterhaltsamer Tag auf die Teilnehmer, an dem bewährte Techniken der Softwareentwicklung verbessert und neue erlernt werden können. Studenten sind ebenso wie berufstätige Softwareentwickler herzlich eingeladen, ihre Erfahrungen auszutauschen und ihr Programmierhandwerk aufzubessern. Die Teilnahme ist kostenlos – für einen Snack wird gesorgt. Für die Teilnahme ist das Mitbringen eines Notebooks inkl. eingerichteter Entwicklungsumgebung für die gewählte Programmiersprache erforderlich! 
Anmeldung unter: http://gdcr2013osnabrueck.eventbrite.de (http://gdcr2013osnabrueck.eventbrite.de/)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Fukui, Japan
description:
Coderetreat (http://archive.coderetreat.org/) is a day-long, intensive practice event focused on the fundamentals of software development and design.The unique coderetreat format (which eliminates the pressure of 'getting things done' and focuses on practicing basic principles of good design) has proven to be a highly effective (and fun) means of skill improvement. 
On December 14th, Coderetreats will be held at cities all over the world. To celebrate this significant event, we'll be participating in some global activities in addition to our normal Coderetreat activities. 
You only need to bring a laptop with the development tools you require to write code using your chosen programming languages.  
Check out coderetreat.org (http://archive.coderetreat.org/) for further details on what to expect. 
Coderetreatとは、ソフトウェアの設計と開発の基礎を徹底的に練習する終日イベントです。仕事では必ずさらされる「終わらせなければならないプレッシャー」からできる限り開放され、「良い設計とはなにか」を考え、実践することに集中できるようイベントが設計されています。そのため、効果的にプログラミング技術を向上させられる楽しいイベントです。 
来る12/14、32時間に渡り200以上の世界中の都市でCoderetreatが開催されます。この記念的な日に参加することで、通常のCoderetreatに加えて、世界中のプログラマとちょっとした交流をするなど、グローバルな体験をすることができるでしょう。 
必要なものはコードを書くためのノートパソコンと、あなたの選んだプログラミング言語の開発環境、そしてちょっとした勇気です。 
(終日のイベントですが、軽食等用意させていただきます。) 
お申込み等詳しい事は申し込みサイトを参照してください。 (http://kokucheese.com/event/index/127798/)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Skopje, Macedonia
description:
Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) 2013 ќе се случи по трет пат и во Македонија. Ве покануваме да ни се придружите на 14ти Декември во просториите на Media Lab во Скопје. 
Coderetreat (http://vimeo.com/18955165) е еднодвенен настан на кој интензивно вежбаме ОО дизајн на софтвер. За време на Coderetreat програмираме во парови (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pair_programming) и разменуваме знаење. Пишуваме код така што прво ќе напишеме тест (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Test-driven_development) за истиот и ги применуваме основни правила на едноставен дизајн (http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?XpSimplicityRules). 
Форматот на настанот е: 
- го решаваме Conway's Game of Life (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life) проблемот
 - програмираме во парови 45 мин и потоа го бришеме кодот
 - правиме 15 минути пауза и ретроспектива
 - правиме промена на парови и нова сесија 
Спонзори на настанот се Ever-Near и Media Lab. За сите учесници ќе има маици со принт од настанот. 
 (http://ever-near.com/) 
 
 (http://siyelo.com/)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Ciudad Lázaro Cárdenas, Mexico

Programadores reunidos en un solo lugar con el fin de compartir conocimientos, charlas y consejos sobre el arte de desarrollar Software usando el formato de Code Retreat, no importa el lenguaje que domines PHP, Java, C++, etc ¡todos estan invitados! 
Comenzando con 6 charlas de 10 minutos cada una hablando sobre las experiencias, el código y el poder mágico que se tiene al construir aplicaciones dadas por: 
 
 Carlos Pérez: Artesanía del Software. 
 Jaime Ferreyra: Introducción a SCALA. 
 Iván Bravo: Programar es divertido, Hackear también. 
 Alejandro Reyes: Pendiente. 
 Araceli Velázques: Pendiente. 
 Marcelo Alonso: Pendiente. 
 

 Al finalizar se tendrá la experiencia de crear un servidor de Chat básico bajo NodeJS (http://nodejs.org/) así que lleva tu editor de código (IDE) favorito y ganas de programar con los demás.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Amsterdam, Netherlands
description:
Zilverline (http://www.zilverline.com/) is hosting the Global Day Coderetreat 2013. 
Our maximum amount of participants is 20 people.  
Zilverline also sponsors: 
- free parking at Science Park (between buildings Matrix 400 and 402)
- lunch, drinks and snacks

When do you start and what’s the plan?
The plan: 
Walk-in at 8:30 
Introduction 9:00 
First start coderetreat session 9:30 
After two sessions we either do another one, or have a (free) lunch (group decision) 
We have beer at 16:00 
We aim at 5, perhaps 6 (depends on energy) coderetreats. 

Conway's Game of Life ? Last year we did Game of Life as well. This year the Code Retreat participants in Cambridge will have a go at it. I'll look up some (hopefully) fresh ideas in mathematical game literature (Smullyan, Allen Paulos etc.).
Yes, Conway's Game of life, it might be a bit repetative if you did many coderetreats before. However, you could also visit a legacy coderetreat session, which uses a different 'puzzle' ;) 
Debugging a legacy code implementing Game of Life? Sounds cool!
Yes, not this time though. 
You should attend a "Legacy Code Retreat" for that. I'd recommend it ;-)
Thank you all, I really had fun today!
Yes, it was really fun. Thanks for coming all;  
as promised, here some urls: 
Life in life: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xP5-iIeKXE8
Stephen Hawking about GoL: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CgOcEZinQ2I 
Thanks again, 
If you want to know about more events, check my twitter feed @stefanhendriks and keep watching the Coderetreat events!
As promised I would let you send a link about the Legacy Coderetreat - http://legacycoderetreat.typepad.com/

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Karachi, Pakistan
description:
Calling fellow hackers,
 
 Active Capital IT is hosting a Global Code Retreat Day. What you get to do is:-
 Meet other like minded developers and be part of a broader initiative
 Get to mentor other developers from the industry and learn from them
 Learn new tools, technologies and languages (Different and diverse programming languages and perspectives are appreciated). Kudos to the person who can implement the Game of Life in Stored Database Procedures :)
 Come up with your own game plan and learn about concepts such as code coverage, pair programming, good design and happy coding.
 Hopefully this will be the first of many events that will eventually gear into other Hacking / Open Source Initiatives.
 And remember, we are all here to learn. So if you havent put on that programming cap in a while, now is the best time to brush up on resources. Creative and novel approaches will be applauded.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - (Spitalfields) London, UK
description:
Unruly is hosting a Global Day Coderetreat 2013 at our offices in London. We use XP every day so have a really nice space for pair programming. 
Facilitator: Steve Tooke 
Global Day of Coderetreat is a world-wide event celebrating passion and software craftsmanship. Last year, over 1800 passionate software developers in 94 cities around the world spent the day practicing the craft of software development using the coderetreat format. This year,200 cities from all over the world will host such events. Since our community pioneered code retreats in Europe, we are glad to continue this tradition.  
What's it about? 
During a code retreat we use pair-programming, to learn from each other. We write our code using Test-Driven Development while applying design principles to produce clean code. Our focus is on learning and there's no pressure to produce a working solution for the problem. 
The format of a code retreat is:  
 
 Problem: Conway’s Game of Life
   
   45 mins write the best code with your pair 
   delete your code (yes, it can be hard) 
   10 minutes retrospectives 
   5 minutes break 
   change your pair  
    
 We have 2-3 coding sessions in the morning 
 Break for lunch around 1pm 
 2-3 more coding sessions in the afternoon. 
 At the end, we'll have a longer retrospective 
 
This code retreat is language agnostic, the main principles are the same for each language. We're hoping to setup some of our pairing workstations for use by code retreat participants but please feel free to bring your own laptop if you have a specific language and IDE that you'd like to use. 
Please aim to arrive by 9am so we can start coding at 9:30am. Lunch and refreshments will be provided. 
About the organisers 
Unruly (http://unrulymedia.com/) are hosting this retreat because we use XP practices everyday and would like to encourage developers to learn more about how much fun it is to work this way. We're always on the lookout for great people to join our team. 
About our facilitator 
Steve Tooke (http://kickstartacademy.io/team#tooky) is an independent programmer, trainer and coach. Passionate about improving his craft and helping others improve theirs. He specialises in helping teams produce business value continuously through improving communication and keeping their code maintainable. BDD is at the core of this process.  
Free registration via Eventbrite (http://gdcr13unruly.eventbrite.co.uk/)

Is there any cost?  Should I bring anything other than a computer?
Free! And, yes, bring a laptop.
Is this an annual event? I'm from NE Ohio, looking for a potential Code Retreat to attend and from what I can tell this is the only regular event in Ohio.
The Global Day of Coderetreat is is an annual event. Pillar hosts it in Columbus every year. I think LeanDog does it in Cleveland.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2013 - Lviv, Ukraine
description:
Global Day of Coderetreat - щорічна подія, що відбувається по всьому світу з метою зібрати програмістів, котрі мають бажання попрактикуватися в передових техніках розробки. Минулого 2012 року прийняли участь більше ніж 2000 розробників із 150 міст світу. 
Що таке Coderetreat 
CodeRetreat проходить у форматі одноденної зустрічі, що базується на практиках TDD та парного програмування. 
Парне програмування з акцентом на написання досконалого коду, а не на вирішення проблеми, дає прекрасну можливість отримати чи вдосконалити свої навики програмування в компанії інших розробників. 
Весь день ділиться на 6 сесій по 45 хвилин. 
Підчас сесії пари розв’язують задачу Conway’s Game of Life, придуману англійським математиком Джоном Конвейем (John Horton Conway). Після кожної сесії пари міняються, щоб максимально сприяти передачі досвіду та знань. Між сесіями весь код видаляється, що дає шанс зробити кожну наступну сесію кращую, не обмежуючись попереднім рішенням. 
Реєстрація 

 
  Попередня 
  реєстрація на сайті Coderetreat (http://archive.coderetreat.org/events/global-day-of-coderetreat-2013-lviv-ukraine)
  . 
  
UPDATE 8 DEC 2013: Для реєстрації заповніть форму (http://bit.ly/gdcr13lvivreg).
 
Вхід безкоштовний. 
"Обмеження" :) 
25 учасників, всі хто зареєструвався пізніше потрапляють у список очікування. 
Щоб “пройти фейсконтроль”, потрібно: 
 
 мати ноутбук, з налаштованим середовищем розробки (можна один на пару) 
 переглянути відео на сайті (coderetreat.org/about (http://archive.coderetreat.org/about)) 
 знати та розуміти основи TDD 
 Познайомитися з правилами Conway’s Game of Life (Wikipedia on Game_of_Life (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway's_Game_of_Life) ) 
 
Подія відбувається за підтримки компанії Itera (http://www.iteraconsulting.com.ua/) - лідера в сфері розробки технологічних та комунікаційних рішень. 
Підчас події будемо "зідзвонюватися" з іншими містами: 
 
 Global day Coderetreat в Києві (https://bitly.com/gdcr13kiev) 
 Global day Coderetrea в Одесі (http://coderetreatodessa.blogspot.com/2013/11/14-1000-1700.html) 
 Global day Coderetreat в інших містах (http://bit.ly/gdcr13map) 
 
Facilitators (модератори) 
 
 Тарас Будурович, taras.budurovych@gmail.com (mailto:taras.budurovych@gmail.com), @tarasbudurovych, +380677954733 
 Дмитрий Малеев, diwingless@gmail.com (mailto:diwingless@gmail.com), @dimko1 (https://twitter.com/dimko1), +380632796784 
 
Організаційні питання - Ольга Жесткова, +380637566440

Added a form (http://bit.ly/gdcr13lvivreg) to gather more details from registrants.
Poster - http://bit.ly/gdcr13lvivposter - please share. 
 (http://api.ning.com/files/-TI4uM2ffQg**V*AlGeFyrsBpdFSvFKDnBbYHwS1Z34WcvWqVoAxAiJUSgRJYLsjJ3MskoJalPhKo3jSQb9ji808MdmklUN4/grcr13lvivpostersmall.png)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Erlangen, Germany
description:
GDCR 2014 @ Erlangen - Hosted and sponsored by Method Park. 
Der GDCR 2014 ist vorbei und es war mal wieder spitze! 
Nach einigen Novemberwetter-typischen krankheitsbedingten Ausfällen waren wir eine kleine aber feine Gruppe von 9 Leuten, die an diesem Tag mehr Spaß hatten als ich mir hätte vorstellen können. Vielen Dank an alle für den Spaß, die Motivation und die vielen Dinge die wir gelernt haben - wahrlich "a day like no other"! 

 Organisatoren: Stefan Clepce (http://plus.google.com/105658716847650435114) (@clepce) und Stefan Holzmüller (http://plus.google.com/116253281120052330033)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Essen, Germany
description:
OPITZ CONSULTING Deutschland GmbH (http://www.opitz-consulting.com/) is hosting the Global Day of Code Retreat 2014 in Essen. 
 // German // 
Ein "Coderetreat (http://archive.coderetreat.org/)" ist eine ganztägige Veranstaltung zum Üben und Verbessern der Fähigkeiten zur Software-Entwicklung und des Software-Designs. In entspannter Atmosphäre und ohne den Druck "fertig" werden zu müssen, können sich Entwickler vollständig auf das Programmieren selbst konzentrieren, Erkenntnisse gewinnen und Erfahrungen mit anderen Teilnehmern austauschen.
 
 Am Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) finden in vielen Städten auf der ganzen Welt Coderetreats statt - so auch dieses Jahr in Essen. Der Veranstaltungsort ist der Standort der OPITZ CONSULTING Deutschland GmbH (http://opitz-consulting.com/).
 
 Voraussetzung für die Teilnahme ist ein funktionsfähiges Notebook, auf dem alle Entwicklungstools eingerichtet sind, die Sie für das Entwickeln in Ihrer Lieblingsprogrammiersprache benötigen.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Lübeck, Germany
description:
We will celebrate the Global day of code retreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) in Lübeck!
 
 During normal work we don´t have much time to work on our core skills as developer. Under time pressure we often use known technics or habits although we know that there are better ways.
 
 As well as an artist we need to have a place where we can practice our skills and that´s what is a code retreat about.
 
 In small sessions we work in pairs so solve a problem (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life)... the whole day. It´s not about being finished, it´s about learning, making errors, trying new ways and having a lot of fun.
 
 Please bring a laptop with your favorite IDE with you so that we can start in time. Lunch and food is offered by Dräger (http://www.draeger.com/sites/de_de/Pages/Krankenhaus/Welcome.aspx). Afterwards we can have some beers in a pub.
 
 The agenda:
 
 8:00 : Arrival and Breakfast
 8:30 : Introduction
 9:00 : Session #1
 9:45 : Retro
 10:00 : Session #2
 10:45 : Retro
 11:00 : Session #3
 11:45 : Retro
 12:00 : Lunch
 13:30 : Session #4
 14:15 : Retro
 14:30 : Session #5
 15:15 : Retrospektive und Pause
 15:30 : Session #6
 16:15 : Retro
 16:30 : Complete Retro for the day
 17:00 : End

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Padova, Italy
description:
Sei stanco di scrivere codice sotto pressione perchè si è sempre in ritardo con le consegne? Hai la sensazione di non avere mai tempo per migliorare il modo in cui scrivi codice perchè sei sempre intento a scriverlo? Ti senti un artigiano del software incompreso che viene trattato da operaio del computer?
 
 Immagina la quantità di spunti e riflessioni che potresti raccogliere in un giorno in cui non dovrai preoccuparti di consegnare (anzi butterai via il codice che scriverai), ti potrai concentrare sulle regole del buon design (http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?XpSimplicityRules) e confrontarti con esperienze e linguaggi di programmazione diversi.
 
 Iscriviti subito al CodeRetreat (maggior info le trovi qui http://archive.coderetreat.org/) di Padova, e partecipa alla giornata mondiale dedicata alla passione per il software! La macchina organizzativa è già in fermento. Abbiamo appena aperto le iscrizioni e sono limitate a soli 20 posti al costo 10 euro comprensivi di colazione e pranzo. 
Il tutto si svolgerà in TalentGarden a Padova! 
-- 
Il Global Day of Coderetreat è un evento internazionale che celebra la passione per la software craftsmanship. 
L'anno scorso più di 2000 developers da 150 città in tutto il mondo hanno dedicato un giorno alla pratica deliberata dello sviluppo software, e quest'anno per la prima volta ci sarà anche Padova (http://archive.coderetreat.org/events/global-day-of-coderetreat-2013-padova-italiy). 
Ci troviamo puntuali alle 9:00 presso TBD per la colazione, e dopo una breve introduzione inizieremo le sessioni. Durante ogni sessione si lavorerà in pair programming per sviluppare in TDD il Game of Life di Conway con un linguaggio qualsiasi scelto indipendentemente da ciascuna coppia. Alla fine di ogni sessione il codice sarà cancellato e ci riunieremo per una breve retrospettiva.  
Se pensi che l'esercizio sia troppo semplice e/o noioso, significa che non hai mai partecipato a un coderetreat: vieni e scopri quante variazioni interessanti sono in serbo per te! :)

description:
(http://api.ning.com/files/NDILiAzzLEUcKXxYD-yMZHDhvDQF7u99qyU8ofwZ*Q3ruRnwnrla36jlrmomUobTK9VzL95Lx5dpZfJt*HoRxxhOpOP6Zvev/personal_programmer.jpg)Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) повторно во Македонија по четврти пат! Годинава, настанот ќе биде во просториите на Ever-Near (http://maps.google.com/maps?q=41.996716,21.429433&num=1&sll=41.996685,21.429351&sspn=0.001298,0.00284&ie=UTF8&ll=41.996715,21.429415&spn=0.001298,0.00284&z=19) во Скопје на 15ти Ноември, 2014. 
Coderetreat (http://vimeo.com/18955165) е еднодневен настан на кој се дружиме и вежбаме ОО дизајн на софтвер со примена на 4-рите правила за едноставен дизајн (http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?XpSimplicityRules) од Kent Beck. 
Форматот на настанот е: 
- се решава Conway's Game of Life (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life)
 - се програмира во парови
 - сесиите траат по 45 мин
 - се прави пауза од 15 минути и мала ретроспектива
 - потоа, промена на парови и нова сесија 
Голема благодарност до спонзорите:

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Arnhem, Netherlands
description:
Global Day of Code Retreat 2014, November 15 at Luminis Arnhem 
November 15, 2014, is this year's Global Day of Code Retreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/). This is a day for us, as developers, to hone our skills, share knowledge, and honor the craft of software engineering. 
Luminis Arnhem will facilitate a coderetreat at our offices in Arnhem. We will provide you with both the facilities and the necessary guidance to get the most out of this day. While we will provide you with exercises and training forms, we remain technology agnostics: you can do your training in any language and tool chain you--and your pair--like. 
What is a coderetreat? 
Coderetreat is a day-­long, intensive practice event focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. The coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement by providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice away from the pressures of 'getting things done.' 
Program 
09:30 Welcome & introduction 
10:00 3 training sessions: 45m of exercise, 10m retrospective, 5m break 
13:00 Lunch 
14:00 3 training sessions: 45m of exercise, 10m retrospective, 5m break 
16:45 Closing ceremony 
17:00 End 
Contact 
To sign up for this coderetreat, RVSP on this page. 
For anything we should know about (for instance, you're a vegan), email kim.rouwenhorst@luminis.eu (mailto:kim.rouwenhorst@luminis.eu) .

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Auckland, New Zealand
description:
Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) is a world-wide event celebrating passion and software craftsmanship. Last year, over 5000 passionate software developers in 170 cities around the world registered to spend the day practicing the craft of software development using the coderetreat format.  
   What is a coderetreat? 
   Coderetreat is a day­long, intensive practice event focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. The coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement by providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice away from the pressures of 'getting things done.'  
   What can you learn? 
   • Pair programming with strangers 
   • Experiment with new programming languages 
   • Write code as you wish without usual real-world constraints... 
   • ... and then write code with some very unusual constraints  
   • Practice 4 rules of simple design  
   • Meet other passionate programmers that you can learn from 
    What do you need? 
   A laptop with the programming environment of your choice (IDE, unit test library, etc.) 
   How can you help? 
   Agenda: 
   8:30 - 9:00 Welcome coffee 
   10:00-10:30 Introduction 
   10:30-11:15 Session #1 
   11:15-11:30 Retrospective  
   11:30-12:15 Session #2  
   12:15-12:30 Retrospective  
   12:30-13:15 Session #3  
   13:15-13:30 Retrospective 
   13:30-14:30 Lunch break 
   14:30-15:15 Session #4  
   15:15-15:30 Retrospective 
   15:30-16:15 Session #5  
   16:15-16:30 Retrospective 
   16:30-17:15 Session #6  
   17:15-17:45 Retrospective of the whole day 
   
 
   17:45 - ??? Other sessions and discussions over a beer :) 
    
 
More info and registration:

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Wroclaw, Poland
description:
Another edition of CodeRetreat in Wroclaw. 
Register at: https://coderetreat-2014-wroclaw.eventbrite.com 
  
Same as last year - we will gather together to improve our TDD skills, and use different platforms and lanugages. It doesn't matter what programming language is your favourite - come and enjoy! 
Event will last for the whole Saturday 15th of November. Food will be provided! 
  
What you need to bring with you: 
- laptop (and a charger for it)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Athens, GA, USA
description:
Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the code retreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time. 

More specifically,  individuals are are grouped into teams of two and each team “solves” a common problem, ‘The Game of Life’.  There are 6 sessions throughout the day and for each session the groups are reorganized and the code deleted.  After each session there are session reflections to help with the  internalization of lessons. 

Snacks and lunches will be provided and it is guaranteed to be something other than pizza.  Sorry pizza lovers :)

For more information about CodeRetreats see http://archive.coderetreat.org/.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Austin, TX, USA
description:
Agile Velocity will be hosting a Coderetreat in Austin as others around the world do the same on the Global Day of Coderetreat (http://gdcr.coderetreat.org (http://gdcr.coderetreat.org/)) on Saturday, November 15, 2014. Come join us at the Agile Velocity offices from 8am-5pm for a day of practicing the craft of programming. 
  
Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time. You can find out more about Coderetreat at http://archive.coderetreat.org (http://archive.coderetreat.org/). 
  
All skill levels are welcome, and everyone will learn something new about programming. You will need a laptop (ready to use a programming language you are comfortable with) and a willingness to pair program with others and have fun. We will work together to explore a programming problem throughout the day in a series of 45 minutes sessions with discussions. 

 Food and drink will be provided for both breakfast and lunch. If you will attend, please register at the Eventbrite link below to help us ensure we have food (and room) for everyone. 
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/global-day-of-coderetreat-tickets-14120818749

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Denver, CO, USA
description:
Pivotal Labs will be hosting a Denver instance of Code Retreat as others around the world do the same. We'll meet at 8am at Pivotal's office within Galvanize and spend the day practicing our craft of programming. 
Pair programming, test-driven development, and conscious practice are the main themes of the day, which we will explore through the lens of a single programming problem in six 45 minute sessions. When a session is over, we'll talk about how we approached the problem: how our choices of language, paradigm, and vocabulary shaped the solution. We'll also think about how our approach to pairing affected the kind of solution that was developed. At the end of the hour, we'll delete our code, find a new pair, and explore the problem again. 
Everyone is welcome - beginner, intermediate, expert - and everyone will learn something new, likely something unexpected, about the craft of programming. You'll need only a few things: a laptop with your favorite development tools, an open mind, and a sense of humor for when we delete our code. 
Food and drink (coffee, tea, soda-pop, but no alcohol) will be provided for both breakfast and lunch. Once we're done, some might decide to socialize at a nearby pub. 
If you will attend, please register - there's a link to Eventbrite below - to help us ensure there is enough food for everyone to be happy. 
See you in November!

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 - Raleigh/Durham, NC, USA
description:
Raleigh/Durham, NC is participating in the Global Day of Coderetreat 2014 (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/)! This event will be facilitated by Cory Foy (http://blog.coryfoy.com/) and hosted at The Iron Yard (http://theironyard.com/locations/raleigh-durham/) offices at the American Underground in downtown Durham. The awesome Smashing Boxes (http://smashingboxes.com/) will be sponsoring food and drinks!
 
Coderetreat (http://archive.coderetreat.org/) is a day-long, intensive practice event focused on the fundamentals of software development and design.The unique coderetreat format (which eliminates the pressure of 'getting things done' and focuses on practicing basic principles of good design) has proven to be a highly effective (and fun) means of skill improvement. We focus on a single problem, leaving you free to explore different approaches, languages and designs.
 
 On November 15th, Coderetreats will be held at cities all over the world. To celebrate this significant event, we'll be participating in some global activities in addition to our normal Coderetreat activities. 
You only need to bring a laptop with the development tools you require to write code using your chosen programming languages. We'll provide the rest!
 
Check out coderetreat.org (http://archive.coderetreat.org/) for further details on what to expect. And please contact me (Cory Foy) if you have any questions at foyc at cory foy dot com. It will be an awesome time! 
Registration is available at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/global-day-of-code-retreat-2014-raleighdurham-tickets-13665073603

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Mogilev, Belarus
description:
Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the code retreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time. 
 
 More specifically,  individuals are are grouped into teams of two and each team “solves” a common problem, ‘The Game of Life’.  There are 6 sessions throughout the day and for each session the groups are reorganized and the code deleted.  After each session there are session reflections to help with the  internalization of lessons.  
Please join us for a full day of hands-on coding practice to improve your craft.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Hangzhou, China
description:
As a person who loves programming, have you ever regretted not crafting your source code into a beautiful one piece, due to schedule pressure? Or have you had trouble  in finding the right person for a deep discussion on programming issues?  We can help you to remove these trouble. 
In Global Day of Coderetreat (GDCR), you’ll have an environment without schedule pressure, spend one day coding for fun, craft your source code, and try different engineering practices. Meanwhile, you can discuss with people around you who may share common interests. 
  
On this day, you’ll practice part or all of below topics according to participants average level: 
 
 Pair-programming 
 Unit test 
 Test driven development (TDD) 
 Code refactoring 
 SW design 
 
  
In each session there’re some interesting rules/limitations, to guide people go beyond the border of their programming habits, and re-think about the important aspects of programming. 
  
Coderetreat home page: www.coderetreat.org (http://www.coderetreat.org/) 
GDCR web page: http://gdcr.coderetreat.org/ 
   
Cost: Free, and with free lunch (Nokia HZ TC sponsors it)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Essen, Germany
description:
OPITZ CONSULTING Deutschland GmbH (http://www.opitz-consulting.com/) is hosting the Global Day of Code Retreat 2015 in Essen. 
 // German // 
Ein "Coderetreat (http://archive.coderetreat.org/)" ist eine ganztägige Veranstaltung zum Üben und Verbessern der Fähigkeiten zur Software-Entwicklung und des Software-Designs. In entspannter Atmosphäre und ohne den Druck "fertig" werden zu müssen, können sich Entwickler vollständig auf das Programmieren selbst konzentrieren, Erkenntnisse gewinnen und Erfahrungen mit anderen Teilnehmern austauschen.
 
 Am Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) finden in vielen Städten auf der ganzen Welt Coderetreats statt - so auch dieses Jahr in Essen. Der Veranstaltungsort ist der Standort der OPITZ CONSULTING Deutschland GmbH (http://opitz-consulting.com/).
 
 Voraussetzung für die Teilnahme ist ein funktionsfähiges Notebook, auf dem alle Entwicklungstools eingerichtet sind, die Sie für das Entwickeln in Ihrer Lieblingsprogrammiersprache benötigen.
 
Anmeldung

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Lübeck, Germany
description:
We will celebrate the Global day of code retreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) in Lübeck!
 
 During normal work we don´t have much time to work on our core skills as developer. Under time pressure we often use known technics or habits although we know that there are better ways.
 
 As well as an artist we need to have a place where we can practice our skills and that´s what is a code retreat about.
 
 In small sessions we work in pairs so solve a problem (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life)... the whole day. It´s not about being finished, it´s about learning, making errors, trying new ways and having a lot of fun.
 
 Please bring a laptop with your favorite IDE with you so that we can start in time. Lunch and food is offered by Dräger (http://www.draeger.com/sites/de_de/Pages/Krankenhaus/Welcome.aspx). Afterwards we can have some beers in a pub.
 
 The agenda:
 
 8:00 : Arrival and Breakfast
 8:30 : Introduction
 9:00 : Session #1
 9:45 : Retro
 10:00 : Session #2
 10:45 : Retro
 11:00 : Session #3
 11:45 : Retro
 12:00 : Lunch
 13:30 : Session #4
 14:15 : Retro
 14:30 : Session #5
 15:15 : Retrospektive und Pause
 15:30 : Session #6
 16:15 : Retro
 16:30 : Complete Retro for the day
 17:00 : End

description:
Die LMIS AG lädt in Kooperation mit Universität und Hochschule Osnabrück alle interessierten Softwareentwickler/innen aus der Region zum »Global Day of Coderetreat« am 14. November 2015 ein.
 
 
 
 Studenten sind ebenso wie berufstätige Softwareentwickler herzlich eingeladen, ihre Erfahrungen auszutauschen und ihr Programmierhandwerk aufzubessern. Die Teilnehmerzahl ist begrenzt auf 20 Personen. Die Teilnahme ist kostenlos – für einen Snack wird gesorgt.
 
 
 
 
 Das Mitbringen eines Notebooks inkl. eingerichteter Entwicklungsumgebung für die gewählte Programmiersprache wird vorausgesetzt!
 
 
 
 
 Wann?  14. November 2015 | 09.00 bis ca. 17.00 Uhr

 Wer? (Informatik-) Studenten und (berufstätige) Softwareentwickler

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Solingen, Germany
description:
Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 at codecentric AG in Solingen! 
   Come and improve your programming skills together with peers, explore new technology or methods, and learn, learn, learn - all without the usual job or project pressure, just for the fun of it!  
   In several sessions of about 45 minutes, we will implement Conway’s “Game of Life (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conways_Game_of_Life)” again and again, and share and compare different solutions, languages and learnings. 
   We will provide a good lunch and drinks. All you need is your curiosity, and preferably your laptop with a programming environment - and we're ready to go! 
   
  
 
 
 
Please RSVP at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/global-day-of-code-retreat-solingen-tickets-19378290990 
// Hosted by codecentric AG (http://codecentric.de/)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Pune, India
description:
[booked up - RSVP disabled] 
Imagine a day writing code just for the love of writing it beautifully! 
A day without the office pressures of "getting things done" ... a day just focused on practicing the art of writing clean, lean, modular and test driven code... 
Welcome to the Global Day of Code Retreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/), an annual global event where passionate programmers come together to hone their skills. 
GDCR 2015 (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) will be held on 14th November 2015 across 100-150 cities around the world... and will involve more than 2000 programmers. 
Equal Experts India (http://www.equalexperts.com/) is proud to host the Pune chapter of GDCR 2015 with support by Nelkinda Software Craft Pvt Ltd (http://nelkinda.com/). Christian Hujer will facilitate this day long event. 
This link (http://archive.coderetreat.org/facilitating/structure-of-a-coderetreat) gives an idea of what a typical Code Retreat Day looks like... and we will be following a similar structure on the day. 
 
 Bring your laptop with your favorite language & IDE installed. 
 Code in any language of your choice. 
 We will be taking care of lunch & evening snacks. 
 You can now also register on Meetup (http://www.meetup.com/expertalks/events/225060649/) if you prefer. 
 
Links

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Skopje, Macedonia
description:
We’re glad to be celebrating the Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) in Macedonia for the fifth time! 
Please join us for an exciting day where not only we would practice OO software design by applying the 4 rules of simple design by Kent Beck but we would also have fun together, push ourselves to be better and learn from one another. 
Coderetreat is a one day event that provides developers the opportunity for skills improvement by focusing on software development and design fundamentals. By practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, participants can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time. It aims to shrink the gap between the code we write under pressure of needing to deliver on time and the perfect code. 
The agenda is as follows: 
- Solve the Conway's Game of Life (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life)
 - Pair programming
 - Each session lasts for 45 min
 - Small break of 15 min allowing time for retrospective
 - Change of pairs and new session 
Snacks and pizza will be provided by the host. 
Please bring your personal laptop. 
Sponsor: 
 
 (http://www.endava.com/) 
 
===== 
 
Note: Registrations on this site are manually approved by admins (not organizer) to prevent spam. Please be patient and report to us if your registration is not approved within a day.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Arnhem, Netherlands
description:
Global Day of Code Retreat 2015, November 14 at Luminis Arnhem 
November 14, 2015, is this year's Global Day of Code Retreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/). This is a day for us, as developers, to hone our skills, share knowledge, and honor the craft of software engineering. 
Luminis Arnhem will facilitate a coderetreat at our offices in Arnhem. We will provide you with both the facilities and the necessary guidance to get the most out of this day. While we will provide you with exercises and training forms, we remain technology agnostics: you can do your training in any language and tool chain you--and your pair--like. 
What is a coderetreat? 
Coderetreat is a day-­long, intensive practice event focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. The coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement by providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice away from the pressures of 'getting things done.' 
Program 
09:30 Welcome & introduction 
10:00 3 training sessions: 45m of exercise, 10m retrospective, 5m break 
13:00 Lunch 
14:00 3 training sessions: 45m of exercise, 10m retrospective, 5m break 
16:45 Closing ceremony 
17:00 End 
Contact 
To sign up for this coderetreat, RVSP on this page. 
For anything we should know about (for instance, you're a vegan), email walter.treur@luminis.eu (mailto:walter.treur@luminis.eu) .

I want to attend, but it's the day after a full week of Devoxx so *fingers crossed*
@Patrick. Have fun at Devoxx! I'll put you on the list just to make sure our security guard will let you through if you are able to attend. ;)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Timisoara, Romania
description:
A coderetreat is a full day event that aims to offer a safe haven for programming experiments. For a whole day, programmers gather to program, experiment, learn, and have fun. It is the ideal place for programmers to do the things they can not do at work. To try out crazy ideas, to improve themselves by interacting with others, to write code using test driven development, pair programming, and other agile practices. 
Global Day of Coderetreat represents a network of such events held in the same day all over the world. Not only programmers can interact with others from the same group, but they can have online chats and live video streams with others from different parts of the world. 
Romania was the first non-US country to host a code retreat, so we have a tradition and passion for this type of events. 
Timisoara hosted its first Coderetreat November 21st 2009 and since then we've participated to all Global Days of Coderetreat.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Bratislava, Slovakia
description:
Máš záujem zlepšiť si svoje písanie kódu?
Rád by si bol pri tom v kolektíve podobných ľudí?

Coderetreat je zaujímavou možnosťou. Je to svetový deň, ktorý spája developerov. Udalosť zameraná na vývoj a dizajn softvéru založená na programovaní v pároch. 


Celý deň je rozdelený do 6-tich workshopov, počas ktorých riešime "Conway’s Game of Life". Páry sa menia každý workshop pre maximalizovanie odovzdania svojich zručností. Po každom workshope je kód vymazaný, čo dáva nasledovnému páru možnosť začať bez ovplyvnenia predchádzajúcim párom.

Minulý rok sa v tento dátum realizovalo okolo 150 Coderetreat udalostí a participovalo 2000 účastníkov po celom svete 

Na stretnutie sa môžete sa prihlásiť cez: http://archive.coderetreat.org/events/global-day-of-coderetreat-2015-bratislava-slovakia.

Počet účastníkov je limitovaný na 25. Obed bude k dispozícii zdarma.

 

Čo potrebujete:

- Notebook s vývojárskym prostredím

- Prečítať pravidlá Conway’s Game of Life (Wikipédia Game of Life)

 

Tešíme sa.

Global Day of Coderetreat is an event held around the world to bring together developers to practice in advanced software development. Last year more than 2,000 developers from 150 cities all around the world joined the event.

 

What is Coderetreat

CodeRetreat is a one-day event based on TDD practices and pair programming.

The combination of pair programming with an emphasis on writing perfect code, not the solution to the problem, provides an excellent opportunity to gain and improve your programming skills in a company of other developers.

The whole day is divided into 6 sessions, 45 minutes each.

During the sessions we solve Conway’s Game of Life. Pairs are changing after each session to maximize the knowledge transfer. After each session written code will be deleted. This gives a chance in each subsequent session to start again, not to be limited by previous decisions.

Participation is free of charge with preliminary registration on Coderetreat web-site or here.

 

Limitation
Number of participants is limited to 25. The rest will be in a waiting list.

 

To participate you need:
— Laptop with configured development environment (possibly one for two).
— Know and understand TDD basics.
— Read Conway’s Game of Life rules (Wikipedia on Game_of_Life).

 

The event is supported by Itera - an international company specializing in communication and technology 
Registration (http://goo.gl/forms/7HZjePnyBd)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 (one day early) - Athens, GA, USA
description:
Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the code retreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time. 

More specifically,  individuals are are grouped into teams of two and each team “solves” a common problem, ‘The Game of Life’.  There are 6 sessions throughout the day and for each session the groups are reorganized and the code deleted.  After each session there are session reflections to help with the  internalization of lessons. 

Snacks and lunches will be provided and it is guaranteed to be something other than pizza.  Sorry pizza lovers :) 
The $10 ticket will be refunded to you the day of the CodeRetreat after we're sure you attend. :)

For more information about CodeRetreats see http://archive.coderetreat.org/.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2015 - Portland, OR, USA
description:
On Saturday, November 14th, Coderetreats will be held all around the world as part of the Global Day of Coderetreat, bringing people together from all over the globe.   Portland continues its strong record of building better developers and growing the Portland software community with its 4th GDCR offering. 

 Come join your fellow programmers to practice the art of software development together.  Write code, learn from others, teach someone else, and expand your network of friends who are passionate about their craft. Show up with your laptop and favorite development tools to participate, everything else is provided.  Continental breakfast and lunch will be served.  The event is free, thanks to generous sponsors covering food costs.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - Hangzhou, China
description:
As a person who loves programming, have you ever regretted not crafting your source code into a beautiful one piece, due to schedule pressure? Or have you had trouble  in finding the right person for a deep discussion on programming issues?  We can help you to remove these trouble.  
 In Global Day of Coderetreat (GDCR), you’ll have an environment without schedule pressure, spend one day coding for fun, craft your source code, and try different engineering practices. Meanwhile, you can discuss with people around you who may share common interests.
  
 On this day, you’ll practice part or all of below topics according to participants average level:
 •               Pair-programming
 •               Unit test
 •               Test driven development (TDD)
 •               Code refactoring
 •               SW design
  
 In each session there’re some interesting rules/limitations, to guide people go beyond the border of their programming habits, and re-think about the important aspects of programming.
  
 Coderetreat home page:  www.coderetreat.org (http://www.coderetreat.org/)
 GDCR web page:  http://gdcr.coderetreat.org/
   
 Ticket: Free, and with free lunch (Nokia HZ TC sponsors it)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - Jihlava, Czech Republic
description:
Coderetreat je jednodenní intenzivní cvičení zaměřené na základy vývoje softwaru. Díky tomu, že vývojáři nejsou pod tlakem rychlého doručování výsledků, poskytuje Coderetreat možnost cíleně se soustředit na zlepšování svých dovedností. Procvičováním základních principů modulárního a objektově-orientovaného návrhu mohou účastníci zlepšit své schopnosti psát kód, který minimalizuje náročnost implementace dalších změn. 
Na akci se prosím registrujte na https://www.meetup.com/gdgjihlava/events/233949957/

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - St Petersburg, Florida
description:
The Iron Yard and Suncoast Developers Guild will be hosting a day-long fun practice event focusing on the fundamentals of software development, design and teamwork that is free to all attendees. By providing developers the opportunity to work side by side, and without the pressures of day-to-day work assignments, the coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill refinement. 
Join us on October. 22nd, 2016 from 9:00 am until about 4:00pm at our campus in Downtown St. Pete; you’ll get a chance to engage with other local developers as you tackle challenging problems together. 
There will be refreshments and food available to all participants.

title: Global Day of Code Retreat 2016 - Lille, France
description:
Vous voulez perfectionner votre manière d’écrire du code, améliorer le design de vos applications, découvrir des pratiques permettant d’améliorer la qualité de votre logiciel ? Nord Agile vous propose de participer à la Code Retreat 2016 organisée dans le cadre duGlobal Day of Code Retreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/). 
La Code Retreat est un espace pour nous permettre de lever la tête de nos projets et découvrir d’autres voies. L’idée est simple : un problème, des portables, des IDE et des binômes. 
Plusieurs itérations vous permettront de résoudre des exercices en codant et en échangeant avec vos pairs avec l’objectif de perfectionner votre art. Au programme : pair-programming, TDD, etc… 
La journée s’organisera en sessions de 45 minutes. Chacune sera suivie d’une rétrospective pour échanger les approches, stratégies, trouvailles. 
Il est à noter que les participants doivent ramener leur portable, sur lequel ils auront installé leur(s) environnement(s) préféré(s). Toute technologie est intéressante, du moment qu’on puisse coder quelques lignes ! 
L’évènement se déroule le samedi 22 octobre de 9h à 17h au WebCenter AXA.L’inscription est obligatoire et gratuite, sur Meetup (https://www.meetup.com/fr-FR/Nord-agile/events/234344850/). 
Merci de ne pas vous inscrire sur coderetreat.org mais sur Meetup. 
A bientôt, 
L’équipe de Nord Agile

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - Paris, France
description:
Venez découvrir le Jeu de la Vie (https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeu_de_la_vie) lors du Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/), un évènement mondial organisé par des communautés locales pour célébrer la passion du code ! 
Au cours de cet atelier d'une journée, vous pourrez vous frotter à un problème de programmation simple mais fascinant avec d'autres Ladies of Code; des mentors seront disponibles pour vous guider et vous conseiller.  
Apportez votre ordinateur ! L'atelier est faisable avec le language de programmation de votre choix, et en binôme. C'est idéal pour découvrir de nouveaux langages et se confronter aux façons de réfléchir des autres participants. 
Ce meetup est sponsorisé par Arolla (http://www.arolla.fr/), qui nous héberge à cette occasion et nous offre le déjeuner. 
Le nombre de places est limité à cause de la taille de la salle, donc si vous avez un empêchement n'oubliez pas de vous désinscrire pour laisser la place à une autre.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - Essen, Germany
description:
OPITZ CONSULTING Deutschland GmbH (http://www.opitz-consulting.com/) is hosting the Global Day of Code Retreat 2016 in Essen. 
 // German // 
Ein "Coderetreat (http://archive.coderetreat.org/)" ist eine ganztägige Veranstaltung zum Üben und Verbessern der Fähigkeiten zur Software-Entwicklung und des Software-Designs. In entspannter Atmosphäre und ohne den Druck "fertig" werden zu müssen, können sich Entwickler vollständig auf das Programmieren selbst konzentrieren, Erkenntnisse gewinnen und Erfahrungen mit anderen Teilnehmern austauschen.

Am Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) finden in vielen Städten auf der ganzen Welt Coderetreats statt - so auch dieses Jahr in Essen. Der Veranstaltungsort ist der Standort der OPITZ CONSULTING Deutschland GmbH (http://opitz-consulting.com/).

Voraussetzung für die Teilnahme ist ein funktionsfähiges Notebook, auf dem alle Entwicklungstools eingerichtet sind, die Sie für das Entwickeln in Ihrer Lieblingsprogrammiersprache benötigen. 
Anmeldung

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - Lübeck, Germany
description:
We will celebrate the Global Day of Code Retreat in Lübeck! 
During normal work we don´t have much time to work on our core skills as developer. Under time pressure we often use known technics or habits although we know that there are better ways. 
As well as an artist we need to have a place where we can practice our skills and that´s what is a code retreat about. 
In small sessions we work in pairs so solve a small given problem... the whole day. It´s not about being finished, it´s about learning, making errors, trying new ways and having a lot of fun. 
Please bring a laptop with your favorite IDE with you so that we can start in time. Lunch, drinks and food is provided by Dräger as well as the cozy athmosphere in their innovation garage. 
Afterwards we can have some beers in a pub.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - Solingen, Germany
description:
Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 at codecentric AG in Solingen! 
  Come and improve your programming skills together with peers, explore new technology or methods, and learn, learn, learn - all without the usual job or project pressure, just for the fun of it!  
  In several sessions of about 45 minutes, we will implement Conway’s “Game of Life (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conways_Game_of_Life)” again and again, and share and compare different solutions, languages and learnings. 
  We will provide a good lunch and drinks. All you need is your curiosity, and preferably your laptop with a programming environment - and we're ready to go! 
  
 
 
 
Please RSVP at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/global-day-of-code-retreat-solingen-tickets-26394773478?aff=eac2 
// Hosted by codecentric AG (http://codecentric.de/)

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - Hyderabad, India
description:
Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the Coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time. 
For an in-depth understanding of the philosophy behind a day of Coderetreat, please watch this introduction video. 
undefined () 
Cleveland Code Retreat Introduction (http://vimeo.com/18955165) from Corey Haines (http://vimeo.com/coreyhaines) on Vimeo (http://vimeo.com/) 
Open for all 
Limited to 30 participants 
You can code in ANY LANGUAGE! 
Participation Process:  
1. If you like to participate in this full day event. Register yourselves in the online form 
2. After we get all the participating we filter and send you a confirmation mail. 
3. Reply back that you are going to attend. If you send us decline or not responding we hope you declined and we give seat to others. 
4. Come up with your laptop loaded with your known and/or to learn language + IDE + testing tool 
FAQ: 
I am student can i join this session? 
YES, all you going to do is basic core lanauge concept in the event. 
What language i can try? 
Any Language in this world from Java, .Net, Scala, etc to C, C++, Python etc. 
What i am going to do? 
Do not worry now, Just attend and see what you learn and the end of the day. 
What is this event all about? 
Software Craftsmanship!. We all have learnt many framework, tools, API etc but we have never mastered the tool we use! This is the place to text your skill of fundamentals of the language 
Fundamentals of language? I am professional i have XX experience, what i will learn out of this? 
You will learn what you have not learnt so far! 
How best i can use this event? 
If you have not learned any new language say Scala etc this is the time. We still have a month to go so take time and learn some basic of language like Scala or anything you like. Come to the event and work with others you learn more! 
Apart from the global day of CodeRetreat Freebies, one participant going to get one year of free license of IntelliJ IDEA.

title: Global Day of Code Retreat 2016 - Bucharest, Romania
description:
RSVP Meetup: https://www.meetup.com/The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meetup-Group/events/234321866/ 
Hi all, 
That day of the year, when programmers from all around the world celebrate together the joy of coding, has come. Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/) is happening on 22nd October. Like every year, our community is participating at the event and is inviting you to practice your craft.  
This year, Alin Pandichi (http://twitter.com/alinpandichi/) is facilitating the coderetreat. You might know him from our previous meetups such as "Bring Your Own Code" and "Coding Dojo". He is also one of the Bucharest Java User Group organizers.  
We will gather in the city center at MozaicWorks (http://mozaicworks.com/) office, our sponsor for this edition. Places are limited, so don't forget to RSVP here: https://www.meetup.com/The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meetup-Group/events/234321866/ 
Prerequisites: 
- Bring a laptop on which you have a working development environment for your chosen programming language.  
- Joy of coding :). 
Agenda: 
9:00 - 9:30 Welcome coffee 
9:30 – 10:00 Intro 
10:00 – 10:45 Session 1 
10:45 – 11:00 Retrospective session 1 
11:00 – 11:45 Session 2 
11:45 – 12:00 Retrospective session 2 
12:00 – 12:45 Session 3 
12:45 – 13:00 Retrospective session 3 
13:00 – 14:30 Lunch sponsored by Mozaic Works 
14:30 – 15:15 Session 4

15:30 – 16:15 Session 5 
16:15 – 16:30 Retrospective session 5 
16:30 – 17:15 Session 6 
17:15 – 17:30 Retrospective session 6 
17:30 – 17:45 Closing circle with beer 
After 18:00 Other closing beers in the town 
======================================== 
Global Day of Coderetreat is a world-wide event celebrating passion and software craftsmanship. Last year, over 5000 passionate software developers in 200 cities around the world registered to spend the day practicing the craft of software development using the coderetreat format (http://archive.coderetreat.org/). Since our community pioneered code retreats in Europe, we are glad to continue this tradition. For more details please visit http://globalday.coderetreat.org/. 
What's it about? 
In our day to day jobs we have the sense of wanting to get it done, that causes to rush. And so we try to cut corners, but sometimes we do not cut the corners in the best way because we do not know enough. 
During a code retreat we use pair-programming, which is wonderful because you can learn a lot from each other. We write our code using TDD and the known design rules. We focus purely on writing beautiful code, there is no pressure to actually produce a working solution for the problem. 
The format of a code retreat is:  
- take a problem: Conway’s Game of Life  
- during 45 minutes sessions write the best code with your pair  
- delete your code (yes, it can be hard)  
- 10 minutes retrospectives  
- 5 minutes break  
- change your pair  
- start a new 45 minutes session 
We have 3 sessions in the morning, after that we have a lunch of 1h - 1h ½, and 3 more sessions in the afternoon. At the end we have a longer retrospective. 
This code retreat is language agnostic, the main principles are the same for each language. 
See you on 22nd October!

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - London, UK
description:
Registration: http://www.meetup.com/london-software-craftsmanship/events/234173628/
 
We are pleased to announce that Codurance together with LSCC is participating to the Global Day of Coderetreat. This year the event will happen on 22th of October.  
Last year's Global Day of Coderetreat (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/timeline-2015.html) attracted over 2000 developers from more than 150 cities around the world. It's becoming a regular fixture in the global software development calendar, and by participating you will be a part of the history of software development: thousands of developers coming together around the world to practise their craft. 
NOTE: Please register for just one of them. LSCC is also organising other coderetreats ( Masabi ). Take the empty spots on a different coderetreat instead of adding yourself to a waiting list. 
Breakfast and lunch will be provided on the day. It's an early start, so sleep well the night before to help get those brain juices flowing. 
Watch our awesome video (8 mins) from GDCR 2012 for a better idea: vimeo.com/56026932 (http://t.co/XMNl0thnuK) 
If you don't know what a coderetreat is, keep reading. 
What is a coderetreat? 
From the website: A Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. 
By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practising the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time. 
How does it work? 
The coderetreat day consists of 5-6 sessions, each session's learnings building upon previous sessions. The morning focuses on becoming comfortable with the problem domain, breaking old habits and beginning focused self-discovery. The afternoon pushes the envelope by challenging pairs to stretch their skills and understanding of abstractions, modular design and test-driven development. 
Coderetreat has an established, time-tested format that is optimized for focused practice. We will be working on implementing Conway's Game of Life in 45-minute sessions. In each one, you'll pair program in whichever language you like, using whichever technologies you and your pair prefer. 
The day will start with breakfast at 8:30am and finish by 5 or 6pm. 
More information 
Video explaining the format: http://archive.coderetreat.org/about 
http://globalday.coderetreat.org/ 
 (http://globalday.coderetreat.org/)http://archive.coderetreat.org/

description:
Registration: https://www.meetup.com/San-Francisco-Software-Craftsmanship/events/234610700/
 
 Global Day of Code Retreat is an annual event where craftspeople from all around the world gather together to practice their craft. Last year the event attracted over 2000 developers from around 150 cities around the globe. In 2016 the event will happen on October 22nd. We will start at 8.30 AM and conclude by 5 PM, of course with the option to end the day with a few drinks. So bring your own laptops, configured with your favorite IDEs and programming languages and come join us for a full day of practice, learning and fun. Light breakfasts, lunch and refreshments will be provided.
 
 For those of you who are not familiar with code retreats, I copied below some of the information from coderetreat.org.
 
 A Code Retreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design.
 
 By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the code retreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time.
 
 A code retreat has an established, time-tested format that is optimized for focused practice.
 
 Structure:
 Length of Session: 45 minutes
 Duration: 8.30am to 5 or 6pm
 Pair-programming is necessary, as the knowledge transfer contained in that activity is essential to the practice
 Prefer using Test-Driven Development (TDD)
 After each session, pairs should be swapped
 After each session, code must be deleted, not put in a branch, not stashed, just deleted with no trace left
 
 The code retreat day consists of 5-6 sessions, each session's learnings building upon previous sessions. The morning focuses on becoming comfortable with the problem domain, breaking old habits and beginning focused self-discovery. The afternoon pushes the envelope by challenging pairs to stretch their skills and understanding of abstractions, modular design and test-driven development.
 
 More information
 
 Video explaining the format: http://archive.coderetreat.org/about
 http://globalday.coderetreat.org/

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - Columbus, OH, USA
description:
A Coderetreat is an intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of "getting things done", the code retreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement.
  
 
  The Global Day of Coderetreat is a specially yearly event where people from across the global all participate in a Coderetreat. This year’s event for Columbus will be hosted as part of 
  Columbus Code Camp (http://columbuscodecamp.com/) so sign up there if you'd like to attend.
  
 
  So what should you expect at a Coderetreat? You should expect to code. Individuals are grouped into teams of two or three and each team works toward a solution to a common problem, in this case 
  Conway’s Game of Life (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life). Each session lasts about an hour and there are several sessions over the course of the day. At the end of each session, code is deleted, groups are shuffled, and there is a retrospective to reflect upon and share what was learned.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - Portland, USA
description:
PDXWIT (http://www.pdxwit.org/) presents a woman-focused Coderetreat in honor of the Global Day of Coderetreat 2016. Coderetreat.org (http://archive.coderetreat.org/) is a self-organized, volunteer led organization dedicated to helping software developers help each other improve their craft. Tanya Crenshaw (https://www.linkedin.com/in/tanya-crenshaw-48457884) and Jean Richardson (https://www.linkedin.com/in/jean-richardson-6596a12) will be teaming up to facilitate PDXWIT (http://www.pdxwit.org/)'s 2016 Coderetreat. The Tech Academy (https://www.learncodinganywhere.com/) is donating space and providing breakfast and lunch for the event.  Come along for a day of codeplay in a supportive environment and help Coderetreat follow the sun during the global celebration of software development! 
RSVP at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/pdx-women-in-tech-pdxwit-coderetreat-2016-tickets-27661828273?aff=es2 
Here's how it works: SW developers of all sorts gather together with their machines and IDE's ready to code Conway's Game of Life for 45 minute sessions. Pairs change with every 45 minute iteration so everyone gets exposed to different problem solving strategies, and everyone learns together:  newbies and master-craft persons alike. There is no expectation to finish coding Conway's Game of Life at any point during the day.  
The purpose is to learn coding problem solving strategies, share skills and experience pairing in a supportive environment.  
PDXWIT (http://www.pdxwit.org/) a community-based non-profit organization with the purpose of strengthening the Portland women in tech community through educational programs, partnerships and events that provide information, connections, resources, opportunities, and a supportive environment for current and potential women in tech, all of whom are committed to helping each other. Our goal is to bring together and empower current women in tech and encourage others to pursue tech careers to help reduce gender imbalance in the industry and address the current negative effects of that imbalance on women.

title: Global Day of Coderetreat 2016 - Salt Lake City, Utah, United States of America (USA)
description:
Please RSVP via EventBrite (https://www.eventbrite.com/e/slc-global-day-of-code-retreat-2016-tickets-28614627120) 
 
a day to celebrate passion and software craftsmanship 
Each year there’s a Saturday set aside where developers around the world gather in person or online to meditate on their coding. It’s one of those global vibration gigs where you can feel the focus and concentration bouncing back and forth from India to Indiana. Our meditation is code, and we set aside this day to merge intention with practice. 
Code Retreat is a “repeatable, day long event focused on practicing the fundamentals of software development." It’s an opportunity to learn (and re-learn) best practices, things like pairing with other developers and doing behavior driven development. Participants get together in some convenient location and go through a series of exercises that teach and reinforce various aspects of working together on a problem and writing tests. 
For each exercise, the problem is always the same: work on solving Conway’s Game of Life. Sometimes, rarely, it actually gets solved, but that’s beside the point. In fact, at the end of each exercise, participants are supposed to delete their code and start over. 
Code Retreats can happen any time, anywhere, but they’re best experienced on a Global Day of Code Retreat. This year, it’ll be October 22, 2016, and there will be more than 115 Code Retreats world wide. In Salt Lake City, we're hosting one at O.C. Tanner Company. 
In addition to hosting, O.C. Tanner will also sponsor food and beverages. We'll have morning snacks, a nice lunch (something that's not pizza), and afternoon snacks.  You're just responsible for bringing yourself and your computer. 
This event will be facilitated by Sean Duncan, organizer of SLC JS Learners and SLC Iron Yard instructor, and Rob Martin, co-organizer of SLC Software Craftsmanship, speaker, and trainer. 
Park at the south end of the main building, and enter through the main entrance. 
 
Please RSVP via EventBrite (https://www.eventbrite.com/e/slc-global-day-of-code-retreat-2016-tickets-28614627120)
